headline.main: Pontiff Spent His Life in Religion From His Boyhood Years; PIUS AT EARLY AGE TURNED TO CHURCH When 10 Years Old He Went to Seminary, Then to Milan and Finally Rome. MADE EXCELLENT RECORD Later as Librarian He Became Close Friend of Benedict XV, His Predecessor.

snippet: Before he was elected Pope on Feb. 8, 1922, Ambrogio Damiano Achille Ratti had made a distinct, although restricted, name for himself in the vocations of priest, scholar, librarian and diplomat, and in the avocations of bibliographer and alpinist.
